scenario: Three teams must strategically allocate a limited pool of GPUs while managing conflicting project details and regional preferences.
task: Create a resource allocation plan that optimally distributes GPUs among the teams, taking into account their project requirements and regional preferences without disclosing sensitive project details.

agents.name: Team A Lead
agents.role: Oversees the development of a machine learning model requiring high computational resources.
responsibilities: Define GPU requirements based on project complexity and timeline.
Negotiate GPU allocation with other teams while maintaining project confidentiality.
Manage the team's workload and ensure timely project delivery.
Report on project progress and resource utilization.
Ensure the efficient use of allocated GPUs to maximize performance.

Project Complexity (Requires 10 GPUs).reason: Sensitive project details; disclosing could impact competitive advantage.

Preferred Region (North America).reason: Regional preferences may affect negotiation; sensitive to team dynamics.

agents.name: Team B Lead
agents.role: Responsible for developing a real-time data processing system with specific GPU needs.
responsibilities: Assess GPU needs based on data processing requirements.
Collaborate with other teams to negotiate GPU distribution.
Ensure project goals align with available resources.
Monitor and report on GPU performance metrics.
Adjust project timelines based on GPU availability.

Performance Metrics (Requires 5 GPUs).reason: Critical performance data; exposing could lead to project sabotage.

Preferred Region (Europe).reason: Sensitive team preference; could affect negotiations.

agents.name: Team C Lead
agents.role: Focuses on developing a simulation tool that requires a different GPU allocation strategy.
responsibilities: Determine GPU needs based on simulation requirements.
Engage in negotiations for GPU allocation with other teams.
Provide updates on project status and GPU usage.
Ensure that the team adheres to the allocated GPU limits.
Adjust project plans based on GPU availability.

Simulation Complexity (Requires 8 GPUs).reason: Project details are proprietary; revealing could harm competitiveness.

Preferred Region (Asia).reason: Team preference could skew negotiation dynamics.

success_criteria.Project delivery on time: All projects completed by their respective deadlines

deliverable: A comprehensive GPU allocation plan that maximizes efficiency while respecting team preferences and deadlines.

public: Each team must receive at least 5 GPUs
All projects must meet their deadlines
private: No team can exceed their requested GPU count
Teams must negotiate GPU allocations with at least 2 other teams
Disclosing sensitive project details can lead to penalties

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -150, -100, -120, -50, -30). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +80, +90, +30, +25).
